location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 34 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the boats captured at Rasel Khyma [Ra's al-Khaymah] by Captain Thomas Perronet Thompson. Noting that the boats appear to have been offered by him as a free gift to Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, to spare them from being burnt.
